title: When is a pandemic over?

multiple-choice.question: Factual Question

options.label: A
options.text: The World Health Organization (WHO) declares a pandemic when a disease is spreading rapidly within a country.

options.label: B
options.text: The WHO declares a pandemic when a disease is spreading rapidly worldwide.

options.label: C
options.text: The WHO declares a pandemic when a disease is no longer a threat to public health.

options.label: D
options.text: The WHO declares a pandemic when a disease is under control within a country.

multiple-choice.question: Conceptual Question

options.label: A
options.text: Herd immunity occurs when a large portion of the population is immune to a disease.

options.label: B
options.text: Herd immunity occurs when a small portion of the population is immune to a disease.

options.label: C
options.text: Herd immunity occurs when a disease is no longer a threat to public health.

options.label: D
options.text: Herd immunity occurs when a disease is spreading rapidly within a country.

multiple-choice.question: Application Question

options.label: A
options.text: What would be the best strategy to contain a pandemic if a vaccine is not available?

options.label: B
options.text: What would be the best strategy to contain a pandemic if a vaccine is available?

options.label: C
options.text: What would be the best strategy to prevent a pandemic?

options.label: D
options.text: What would be the best strategy to treat a pandemic?

multiple-choice.question: Analytical Question

options.label: A
options.text: Which strategy to contain a pandemic is the most effective in terms of speed and efficiency, and low loss of life?

options.label: B
options.text: Which strategy to contain a pandemic is the most effective in terms of cost and accessibility?

options.label: C
options.text: Which strategy to contain a pandemic is the most effective in terms of long-term impact on public health?

options.label: D
options.text: Which strategy to contain a pandemic is the most effective in terms of short-term impact on public health?

multiple-choice.question: Factual Question

options.label: A
options.text: The pandemic will end as soon as a vaccine is available.

options.label: B
options.text: The pandemic will end once 40-90% of the population has received the vaccine.

options.label: C
options.text: The pandemic will end once the virus is completely eradicated.

options.label: D
options.text: The pandemic will end once the virus is no longer a threat to public health.

multiple-choice.question: Conceptual Question

options.label: A
options.text: Vaccination is the most effective strategy to contain a pandemic.

options.label: B
options.text: Coordination and Crush is the most effective strategy to contain a pandemic.

options.label: C
options.text: Racing through it is the most effective strategy to contain a pandemic.

options.label: D
options.text: Delay and Vaccinate is the most effective strategy to contain a pandemic.

multiple-choice.question: Application Question

options.label: A
options.text: What are the benefits of developing a vaccine for a pandemic?

options.label: B
options.text: What are the drawbacks of developing a vaccine for a pandemic?

options.label: C
options.text: What are the risks of developing a vaccine for a pandemic?

options.label: D
options.text: What are the benefits of not developing a vaccine for a pandemic?

multiple-choice.question: Analytical Question

options.label: A
options.text: What are the long-term consequences of a pandemic on public health?

options.label: B
options.text: What are the short-term consequences of a pandemic on public health?

options.label: C
options.text: What are the economic consequences of a pandemic on a country?

options.label: D
options.text: What are the social consequences of a pandemic on a community?

multiple-choice.question: Factual Question

options.label: A
options.text: The World Health Organization (WHO) has declared a pandemic due to a highly infectious, sometimes deadly respiratory virus.

options.label: B
options.text: The World Health Organization (WHO) has declared a pandemic due to a highly infectious, sometimes deadly respiratory virus.

options.label: C
options.text: The World Health Organization (WHO) has declared a pandemic due to a highly infectious, sometimes deadly respiratory virus.

options.label: D
options.text: The World Health Organization (WHO) has declared a pandemic due to a highly infectious, sometimes deadly respiratory virus.

multiple-choice.question: Conceptual Question

options.label: A
options.text: Herd immunity is achieved when a large portion of the population is immune to a disease.

options.label: B
options.text: Herd immunity is achieved when a small portion of the population is immune to a disease.

options.label: C
options.text: Herd immunity is achieved when a disease is no longer a threat to public health.

options.label: D
options.text: Herd immunity is achieved when a disease is spreading rapidly within a country.
